clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Routine Use of Narrow Band Imaging on Heterotopic Gastric Mucosa of the Proximal Esophagus Detection
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Routine Use of Narrow Band Imaging on Heterotopic Gastric Mucosa of the Proximal Esophagus Detection
clinical_study.source: H-T. Centrum Medyczne Sp. z o.o. sp. k

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to determine whether Narrow Band Imaging(NBI) should be routinely used during esophagus inspection at diagnostic gastroscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: Heterotopic gastric mucosa, also called inlet patch, is area of ectopic gastric mucosa with common location at proximal part of esophagus. Because of the location, lesions are likely to be missed during routine gastroscopy. The clinical significance of inlet patches remains unknown, however they may be symptomatic and may cause morphologic changes such as strictures, ulcers, webs, stenoses or even adenocarcinomas. Moreover inlet patches may be correlated with reflux symptoms up to 73,1%. Several studies were conducted to determine whether NBI improves detection of cervical inlet patches, some of them were also prospective studies, however no randomized study was conducted.

primary_outcome.measure: Detection of heterotopic gastric mucosa in the proximal esophagus

secondary_outcome.measure: Detection of other upper gastrointestinal lesions
Correlation of throat and esophageal reflux symptoms with cervical inlet patches
Rate of cervical inlet patches verified with NBI in endoscopies performed in standard white light endoscopy
Correlation of subject's subjective purpose of gastroscopy and cervical inlet patch occurrence

intervention.intervention_name: Esophagus inspection in Narrow Band imaging and increased care.
intervention.description: During the endoscope withdrawal after cardia examination NBI will be used for esophagus inspection and with increased care of cervical inlet patches detection.

intervention.description: Whole procedure will be performed in standard High definition endoscopy with increased care of cervical inlet patches detection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Referral for diagnostic gastroscopy
- Ability to undergo diagnostic gastroscopy
- Provided written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18
- Prisoners
- Pregnancy
- Gastroscopy with treatment procedure
- Inability to provide informed consent
